segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and this is our 300th lesson here at EnglishPod, so it's a special lesson.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天是我们在EnglishPod的第300节课，所以这是特别的一课。

segments.en: But today we're talking a little bit about dating.
segments.cn: 今天我们要聊聊约会。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we're going to talk about dating now, in a little bit of a less conventional way, a new type of dating, very modern, with using technology.
segments.cn: 今天我们将以一种不太传统的方式谈论约会，一种非常现代的约会方式，利用科技。

segments.en: Using technology, that's right.
segments.cn: 利用科技，没错。

segments.en: So let's listen to today's dialogue, and we'll be back in a moment.
segments.cn: 那么让我们来听今天的对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Do you want to hang out tomorrow?
segments.cn: 你明天想一起出去吗？

segments.en: Oh, I can't.
segments.cn: 哦，我不能。

segments.en: I have a date.
segments.cn: 我有个约会。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Wow, with who?
segments.cn: 哇，和谁？

segments.en: This girl I've been chatting with for the past couple of months.
segments.cn: 这个我聊了几个月的女孩。

segments.en: She's really cool and she's driving over here this weekend.
segments.cn: 她真的很酷，这个周末她会开车过来。

segments.en: Wait a minute.
segments.cn: 等一下。

segments.en: You mean you met her online?
segments.cn: 你是说你在网上认识她？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I signed up for a website called Match.com, and it's great.
segments.cn: 我注册了一个叫Match.com的网站，真的很棒。

segments.en: You fill in all your details and preferences, like if you are a smoker, or if you have any pets.
segments.cn: 你填写所有的个人信息和偏好，比如你是否吸烟，或者你是否有宠物。

segments.en: Then you find people that have similar characteristics and you can email them or chat.
segments.cn: 然后你可以找到有相似特征的人，可以给他们发邮件或聊天。

segments.en: That's kind of weird.
segments.cn: 这有点奇怪。

segments.en: What if she's a psycho or something like that?
segments.cn: 如果她是个精神病患者怎么办？

segments.en: It's the same as meeting people anywhere and dating them.
segments.cn: 这和在任何地方认识人并约会是一样的。

segments.en: I'm just tired of going to bars or being set up for dates by my friends.
segments.cn: 我只是厌倦了去酒吧或被朋友安排约会。

segments.en: I think this is a really cool alternative, especially if you are a bit shy.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是一种很酷的替代方式，尤其是如果你有点害羞。

segments.en: I guess it does seem logical.
segments.cn: 我想这确实看起来很合理。

segments.en: I'll have to check it out.
segments.cn: 我得去看看。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at some of these keywords that we've picked out for you on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看我们为你挑选的一些关键词。

segments.en: So the first word is a word that you're going to hear English speakers say all the time, especially if they're Americans.
segments.cn: 第一个词是你会经常听到英语使用者，尤其是美国人说的。

segments.en: So, cool is our first word.
segments.cn: 所以，“酷”是我们的第一个词。

segments.en: Right, this guy described this girl that he is seeing as really cool.
segments.cn: 对，这个家伙形容他正在约会的女孩为“真的很酷”。

segments.en: She's really cool.
segments.cn: 她真的很酷。

segments.en: So what does that mean if I describe someone as a cool person?
segments.cn: 那么如果我形容某人为酷的人，这意味着什么？

segments.en: A cool person is someone who you like.
segments.cn: 酷的人是你喜欢的人。

segments.en: It's a good thing.
segments.cn: 这是好事。

segments.en: So someone who is cool, I think of as relaxed and interesting and someone who maybe had lots of ideas or things to say.
segments.cn: 所以我认为酷的人是放松、有趣的人，可能有很多想法或话要说。

segments.en: Okay, so if you say that a person is cool, you're saying that you like that person.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以如果你说一个人很酷，你是在说你喜欢这个人。

segments.en: Now, what if you say something is cool, like Paris is really cool?
segments.cn: 现在，如果你说某样东西很酷，比如巴黎真的很酷呢？

segments.en: Paris is cool.
segments.cn: 巴黎很酷。

segments.en: It's a cool city.
segments.cn: 这是个酷城市。

segments.en: That means it's an interesting city.
segments.cn: 这意味着这是个有趣的城市。

segments.en: It's something that you like.
segments.cn: 这是你喜欢的东西。

segments.en: Maybe you're trying to recommend someone to go there.
segments.cn: 也许你在推荐某人去那里。

segments.en: You can also say, that movie was really cool.
segments.cn: 你也可以说，那部电影真的很酷。

segments.en: So again, it means you liked it.
segments.cn: 所以这再次意味着你喜欢它。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Okay, so talking about dating, this friend was a bit surprised when he said that he met this girl online.
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到约会，这位朋友在他说他在网上认识这个女孩时有点惊讶。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So online, where is this place online?
segments.cn: 那么“在线”这个地方在哪里？

segments.en: It's in cyberspace.
segments.cn: 在网络空间。

segments.en: Alright, so online means on the Internet.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以“在线”意味着在互联网上。

segments.en: And we often use this when describing things.
segments.cn: 我们通常在描述事物时使用这个词。

segments.en: So EnglishPod is an online English learning site.
segments.cn: 所以EnglishPod是一个在线英语学习网站。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So anything that is in the Internet, in cyberspace, you say that is online.
segments.cn: 所以任何在互联网上的东西，在网络空间中，你都可以说是在线的。

segments.en: So our website is online.
segments.cn: 所以我们的网站是在线的。

segments.en: Or maybe you have pictures online.
segments.cn: 或者你可能有在线的照片。

segments.en: I have many photographs online.
segments.cn: 我有很多在线的照片。

segments.en: Or I like to meet people online.
segments.cn: 或者我喜欢在线认识人。

segments.en: Okay, so continuing on, we talked about a website, obviously, that's online where you find people.
segments.cn: 好吧，继续，我们谈到了一个网站，显然是在线的，你可以在上面找到人。

segments.en: And talking about preferences, you mentioned that you can state whether you are a smoker or if you have pets.
segments.cn: 说到偏好，你提到你可以说明你是否吸烟或是否有宠物。

segments.en: So what is a person that's a smoker?
segments.cn: 那么吸烟的人是什么样的人？

segments.en: Well, many of you have probably heard the term to smoke before.
segments.cn: 嗯，你们中的许多人可能听过“吸烟”这个词。

segments.en: I smoke cigarettes, I smoke.
segments.cn: 我吸烟，我吸烟香烟。

segments.en: But a smoker is a person who smokes cigarettes.
segments.cn: 但吸烟者是指吸烟香烟的人。

segments.en: And so I could say that I want a non-smoker if I'm looking for a boyfriend.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说如果我在找男朋友，我想要一个不吸烟的人。

segments.en: Because I don't want someone who smokes.
segments.cn: 因为我不想要一个吸烟的人。

segments.en: But maybe if you do smoke, you can say I'm looking for a smoker, someone who does smoke.
segments.cn: 但也许如果你吸烟，你可以说我在找一个吸烟者，吸烟的人。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So his friend was a little bit concerned, saying, well, that's weird.
segments.cn: 所以他的朋友有点担心，说，这有点奇怪。

segments.en: What if this girl is a psycho or something like that?
segments.cn: 如果这个女孩是个精神病患者怎么办？

segments.en: Alright, a psycho.
segments.cn: 好吧，精神病患者。

segments.en: Now maybe you've heard of the movie Psycho?
segments.cn: 也许你听说过电影《精神病患者》？

segments.en: But Psycho is something that we use in English to say that someone is really crazy, almost scary crazy.
segments.cn: 但“精神病”是我们用来形容某人真的很疯狂，几乎是可怕的疯狂。

segments.en: It comes from the word psychopath, right?
segments.cn: 它来自“精神病患者”这个词，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And a psychopath is someone who is crazy but also very dangerous.
segments.cn: 而精神病患者是指疯狂但也非常危险的人。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So obviously when we use this word, we're describing someone as being a little bit strange or maybe even a little bit dangerous.
segments.cn: 所以显然当我们使用这个词时，我们是在形容某人有点奇怪，甚至可能有点危险。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we don't want any psychos to come and talk to us online, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们不希望有精神病患者来网上和我们聊天，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So he went on to explain how dating is just the same online as it is offline.
segments.cn: 所以他接着解释说，在线约会和离线约会是一样的。

segments.en: And that he thinks it's a really cool alternative, even if you're shy.
segments.cn: 他认为这是一种很酷的替代方式，即使你很害羞。

segments.en: So something is an alternative if you have different options.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有不同的选择，某样东西就是替代品。

segments.en: Maybe dating by going to a bar and meeting someone is what normal people do.
segments.cn: 也许去酒吧约会和认识某人是正常人做的事情。

segments.en: But an alternative to that would be dating online.
segments.cn: 但替代的方式就是在线约会。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: That means it's another option.
segments.cn: 这意味着这是另一个选择。

segments.en: So the word alternative is a second option, another option.
segments.cn: 所以“替代”这个词是第二个选择，另一个选择。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: For example, if I want to go have Italian food tonight but you don't want to, I'd say, Hey Marco, can you give me an alternative idea?
segments.cn: 例如，如果我今晚想吃意大利菜，但你不想，我会说，嘿Marco，你能给我一个替代的主意吗？

segments.en: That is the other option.
segments.cn: 那就是另一个选择。

segments.en: Alright, great.
segments.cn: 好的，很好。

segments.en: So a lot of words in this very interesting dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以在这个非常有趣的对话中有很多词。

segments.en: Stay with us.
segments.cn: 请继续关注我们。

segments.en: We'll be right back where we'll take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们马上回来，我们将看看流利度提升。

segments.en: Do you want to hang out tomorrow?
segments.cn: 你明天想一起出去吗？

segments.en: Oh, I can't.
segments.cn: 哦，我不行。

segments.en: I have a date.
segments.cn: 我有个约会。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: With who?
segments.cn: 和谁？

segments.en: This girl I've been chatting with for the past couple of months.
segments.cn: 这个我聊了几个月的女孩。

segments.en: She's really cool and she's driving over here this weekend.
segments.cn: 她真的很酷，这个周末她会开车过来。

segments.en: Wait a minute.
segments.cn: 等一下。

segments.en: You mean you met her online?
segments.cn: 你是说你在网上认识她？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I signed up for a website called Match.com and it's great.
segments.cn: 我注册了一个叫Match.com的网站，挺好的。

segments.en: You fill in all your details and preferences, like if you are a smoker or if you have any pets.
segments.cn: 你填写所有的个人信息和偏好，比如你是否吸烟或是否有宠物。

segments.en: Then you find people that have similar characteristics and you can email them or chat.
segments.cn: 然后你可以找到有相似特征的人，可以给他们发邮件或聊天。

segments.en: That's kind of weird.
segments.cn: 这有点奇怪。

segments.en: What if she's a psycho or something like that?
segments.cn: 如果她是个精神病患者怎么办？

segments.en: It's the same as meeting people anywhere and dating them.
segments.cn: 这和在任何地方认识人并约会是一样的。

segments.en: I'm just tired of going to bars or being set up for dates by my friends.
segments.cn: 我只是厌倦了去酒吧或被朋友安排约会。

segments.en: I think this is a really cool alternative, especially if you are a bit shy.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是一个很酷的替代方案，尤其是如果你有点害羞。

segments.en: I guess it does seem logical.
segments.cn: 我想这确实很合理。

segments.en: I'll have to check it out.
segments.cn: 我得去看看。

segments.en: Alright, we're back and we've picked out five key phrases for you.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了，我们为你挑选了五个关键短语。

segments.en: Let's check those out on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们在流利度构建器上看看这些。

segments.en: Fluency Builder Alright, the first phrase we've got here is one that we often use in English, spoken English, to talk about seeing our friends.
segments.cn: 流利度构建器 好的，第一个短语是我们在英语口语中常用的，谈论见朋友。

segments.en: Okay, so the first person says, do you want to hang out tomorrow?
segments.cn: 好的，第一个人说，你想明天一起出去吗？

segments.en: To hang out.
segments.cn: 一起出去。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对的。

segments.en: So let's hang out.
segments.cn: 所以我们一起出去吧。

segments.en: We never hang out anymore.
segments.cn: 我们再也不一起出去。

segments.en: What does that mean?
segments.cn: 这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, to hang out is... it's hard to define because you can do many things when you're hanging out.
segments.cn: 嗯，一起出去很难定义，因为你可以在一起做很多事情。

segments.en: But basically it means friends being together.
segments.cn: 但基本上它意味着朋友在一起。

segments.en: So, watching a movie, listening to music, chatting, these are all examples of hanging out.
segments.cn: 所以，看电影、听音乐、聊天，这些都是一起出去的例子。

segments.en: So maybe if you get together with your friend and just sit in the living room and talk, you're hanging out.
segments.cn: 所以也许如果你和朋友聚在一起，只是在客厅里聊天，你们就是在一起。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对的。

segments.en: Or you could go drive a car together and you're hanging out, you're talking.
segments.cn: 或者你们可以一起开车，你们在一起，聊天。

segments.en: So to hang out is to be social, is to talk to your friends.
segments.cn: 所以一起出去就是社交，就是和朋友聊天。

segments.en: To spend time together.
segments.cn: 一起度过时间。

segments.en: And he said, wait, oh, I can't because I have a date.
segments.cn: 然后他说，等一下，哦，我不行，因为我有个约会。

segments.en: Okay, to have a date.
segments.cn: 好的，有个约会。

segments.en: So a date is a romantic appointment with someone that you want to go out with.
segments.cn: 所以约会是和你想约会的人的浪漫约定。

segments.en: But you have a date.
segments.cn: 但你有个约会。

segments.en: This is something you have.
segments.cn: 这是你拥有的东西。

segments.en: I have a date that night.
segments.cn: 我那晚有个约会。

segments.en: So this is actually a very important part because as you said, it's a romantic appointment.
segments.cn: 所以这实际上是一个非常重要的部分，因为正如你所说，这是一个浪漫的约定。

segments.en: So if you have to go to the doctor and he's not your boyfriend or anything like this, you don't say, I have a date with the doctor.
segments.cn: 所以如果你要去看医生，而他不是你的男朋友或其他什么，你不会说，我和医生有个约会。

segments.en: No, you say, I have an appointment with the doctor.
segments.cn: 不，你会说，我和医生有个预约。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: But if it's romantic, you say, ooh, I want to get my hair done because I have a date tonight.
segments.cn: 但如果是浪漫的，你会说，哦，我想去做头发，因为我今晚有个约会。

segments.en: Right, I have a date.
segments.cn: 对，我有个约会。

segments.en: I want to look nice for my date.
segments.cn: 我想为我的约会打扮得好看。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And then he goes on to explain that this date that he has is with a girl that he has been chatting with.
segments.cn: 然后他继续解释说，他的约会是和一个他一直在聊天的女孩。

segments.en: Okay, so the verb here is to chat with, chat.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这里的动词是聊天，聊天。

segments.en: Chat just means to talk to.
segments.cn: 聊天只是意味着交谈。

segments.en: But in Internet terms, to chat with means to talk to on the Internet.
segments.cn: 但在互联网术语中，聊天意味着在网上交谈。

segments.en: So maybe you use a program like MSN or Google Gchat to talk to somebody online.
segments.cn: 所以也许你使用像MSN或Google Gchat这样的程序在线与某人交谈。

segments.en: That's called chatting.
segments.cn: 这叫做聊天。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对的。

segments.en: So I think everyone has done this at one point or another when you are online chatting via MSN messenger or any of these chat clients.
segments.cn: 所以我想每个人在某个时候都做过这个，当你在线通过MSN Messenger或任何这些聊天客户端聊天时。

segments.en: So very, very common thing.
segments.cn: 所以这是非常非常常见的事情。

segments.en: But remember to add the chat with.
segments.cn: 但记得加上聊天。

segments.en: I am chatting with my friends.
segments.cn: 我正在和我的朋友聊天。

segments.en: Yeah, I don't like to chat with people while I'm at work on the Internet.
segments.cn: 是的，我不喜欢在工作时在网上和人聊天。

segments.en: Now this guy explained about the website match.com and he said that he signed up for this website.
segments.cn: 现在这个家伙解释了关于网站match.com，他说他注册了这个网站。

segments.en: Okay, another really key verb when you are talking about Internet things.
segments.cn: 好的，另一个在谈论互联网时非常关键的动词。

segments.en: So for example, if you want to come to EnglishPod, you can sign up for a free trial.
segments.cn: 所以例如，如果你想来EnglishPod，你可以注册一个免费试用。

segments.en: That means provide your information, right?
segments.cn: 这意味着提供你的信息，对吧？

segments.en: Start to use.
segments.cn: 开始使用。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对的。

segments.en: So it applies for things online and offline.
segments.cn: 所以它适用于在线和离线的事情。

segments.en: For example, in the real world or offline, you can sign up for a cooking class.
segments.cn: 例如，在现实世界或离线，你可以注册一个烹饪课程。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对的。

segments.en: Or last week I signed up for a dance class so I can learn how to dance.
segments.cn: 或者上周我注册了一个舞蹈课程，以便学习如何跳舞。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And then to finish off, the guy explained that he is tired of meeting people at bars or that his friends set up dates for him.
segments.cn: 然后最后，这个家伙解释说他厌倦了在酒吧认识人，或者他的朋友为他安排约会。

segments.en: Okay, so he doesn't like to be set up.
segments.cn: 好的，所以他不喜欢被安排。

segments.en: To be set up, remember that B, to be set up.
segments.cn: 被安排，记住那个B，被安排。

segments.en: That means someone else is doing this to you.
segments.cn: 这意味着别人为你做这个。

segments.en: So Marco, I want to set you up with my friend.
segments.cn: 所以Marco，我想把你和我的朋友安排在一起。

segments.en: That means I want to take you and my friend and make you have a date.
segments.cn: 这意味着我想把你和我的朋友带在一起，让你们约会。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，没错。

segments.en: So this is exactly what it means.
segments.cn: 所以这正是它的意思。

segments.en: To set someone up or to be set up is to have them go on a date with someone else.
segments.cn: 安排某人与某人约会或被安排就是和其他人约会。

segments.en: Alright, so I don't like to be set up because I like to know the person I will have a date with before we go out.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我不喜欢被安排，因为我想在约会前了解我将要约会的人。

segments.en: But when you're set up, someone else makes the decision for you.
segments.cn: 但当你被安排时，别人为你做决定。

segments.en: So it's a little bit difficult.
segments.cn: 所以这有点困难。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 对的。

segments.en: Okay, so a lot of interesting things here.
segments.cn: 好的，这里有很多有趣的事情。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at our dialogue one last time and we'll be right back.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不最后再看看我们的对话，我们马上回来。

segments.en: Do you want to hang out tomorrow?
segments.cn: 你想明天一起出去吗？

segments.en: Oh, I can't.
segments.cn: 哦，我不行。

segments.en: I have a date.
segments.cn: 我有个约会。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Wow, with who?
segments.cn: 哇，和谁？

segments.en: This girl I've been chatting with for the past couple of months.
segments.cn: 这个我聊了几个月的女孩。

segments.en: She's really cool and she's driving over here this weekend.
segments.cn: 她真的很酷，这个周末她会开车过来。

segments.en: Wait a minute.
segments.cn: 等一下。

segments.en: You mean you met her online?
segments.cn: 你是说你在网上认识她？

segments.en: Yeah, I signed up for a website called Match.com and it's great.
segments.cn: 是的，我注册了一个叫Match.com的网站，挺好的。

segments.en: You fill in all your details and preferences.
segments.cn: 你填写所有的个人信息和偏好。

segments.en: Like if you are a smoker or if you have any pets.
segments.cn: 比如你是否吸烟或者有没有宠物。

segments.en: Then you find people that have similar characteristics and you can email them or chat.
segments.cn: 然后你可以找到有相似特征的人，可以给他们发邮件或聊天。

segments.en: That's kind of weird.
segments.cn: 这有点奇怪。

segments.en: What if she's a psycho or something like that?
segments.cn: 如果她是个精神病患者怎么办？

segments.en: It's the same as meeting people anywhere and dating them.
segments.cn: 这和在任何地方认识人并约会是一样的。

segments.en: I'm just tired of going to bars or being set up for dates by my friends.
segments.cn: 我只是厌倦了去酒吧或被朋友安排约会。

segments.en: I think this is a really cool alternative, especially if you are a bit shy.
segments.cn: 我觉得这是一个很酷的选择，尤其是如果你有点害羞。

segments.en: I guess it does seem logical.
segments.cn: 我想这确实看起来很合理。

segments.en: I'll have to check it out.
segments.cn: 我得去看看。

segments.en: Alright, so talking about setting up.
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到安排。

segments.en: This is another word that comes to mind when your friends set you up for a date is a blind date.
segments.cn: 朋友为你安排约会时，另一个想到的词是相亲。

segments.en: Okay, so a blind date is not a date with two blind people.
segments.cn: 好吧，相亲不是两个盲人的约会。

segments.en: A blind date is a date that you go to when you don't know who the other person is before you go.
segments.cn: 相亲是你去约会时不知道对方是谁。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So for example, my friend's mother loves to set people up on blind dates.
segments.cn: 比如，我朋友的妈妈喜欢给人安排相亲。

segments.en: She's a match maker.
segments.cn: 她是个红娘。

segments.en: She makes couples.
segments.cn: 她促成情侣。

segments.en: And so she will call one person and call the other person and then she'll make them have a date.
segments.cn: 她会给一个人打电话，再给另一个人打电话，然后让他们约会。

segments.en: She sets them up and then they have this date, a blind date.
segments.cn: 她安排他们，然后他们就有了这个约会，相亲。

segments.en: A blind date, that's right.
segments.cn: 相亲，没错。

segments.en: And actually what you're doing with this technology now that you can use a website to find and meet people who are also looking for romance.
segments.cn: 实际上，你现在用这种技术可以通过网站找到和认识也在寻找爱情的人。

segments.en: It's very interesting.
segments.cn: 这很有趣。

segments.en: It's very modern obviously because now we have the technology to do it.
segments.cn: 这显然很现代，因为我们现在有技术可以做到。

segments.en: And many people actually have very successful or very great love stories of how they met online.
segments.cn: 许多人实际上都有非常成功或很棒的爱情故事，讲述他们是如何在网上相遇的。

segments.en: Chatting or while playing a video game online or many different things like this.
segments.cn: 聊天或在网上玩视频游戏，或者很多类似的事情。

segments.en: Well, the thing that I like about it, and I have to say I've never done it.
segments.cn: 嗯，我喜欢它的一点，我得说我从来没有尝试过。

segments.en: So what I like from hearing about it is that like Match.com, you save a lot of time.
segments.cn: 我听说的喜欢的是，像Match.com，你节省了很多时间。

segments.en: It seems that way.
segments.cn: 看起来确实如此。

segments.en: Because you get to tell the person, hey, I don't like people who smoke, I don't like people who have pets, but I really like people who play video games.
segments.cn: 因为你可以告诉对方，嘿，我不喜欢吸烟的人，我不喜欢有宠物的人，但我真的喜欢玩视频游戏的人。

segments.en: And so you find people who are like that and then you can, you know, get to know that person better.
segments.cn: 所以你找到这样的人，然后你可以更好地了解那个人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: I think it's hard when you're going on dates, especially, you know, your friends, they set you up.
segments.cn: 我觉得约会很难，尤其是你知道，你的朋友给你安排。

segments.en: And you have nothing in common.
segments.cn: 你们没有共同点。

segments.en: You have no interests that are in common.
segments.cn: 你们没有共同的兴趣。

segments.en: And that can be really frustrating.
segments.cn: 这可能真的很让人沮丧。

segments.en: So it seems like online dating is a new type of efficient way of dating.
segments.cn: 所以看起来网上约会是一种新的高效约会方式。

segments.en: Because you preliminary already filter out everyone or everything that you don't like about a person.
segments.cn: 因为你已经初步筛选掉了你不喜欢的人的所有特征。

segments.en: And you find someone that has your same or similar likes.
segments.cn: 你找到一个有相似喜好的人。

segments.en: But that's modern day, right?
segments.cn: 但这就是现代社会，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: A lot of people I know have dated using these websites and have been very successful.
segments.cn: 我认识的很多人都通过这些网站约会，并且非常成功。

segments.en: Really been married.
segments.cn: 真的结婚了。

segments.en: Wow, it's amazing.
segments.cn: 哇，太神奇了。

segments.en: So actually, this is a great thing.
segments.cn: 所以实际上，这是一件好事。

segments.en: Let us know if you have any friend who has found their significant other, husband or wife via online dating, or if you've tried it.
segments.cn: 如果你有朋友通过网上约会找到了另一半，丈夫或妻子，或者你尝试过，请告诉我们。

segments.en: Maybe you can let us know how it is.
segments.cn: 也许你可以告诉我们体验如何。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: Don't forget to sign up if you don't have an account and we'll see you there.
segments.cn: 如果你还没有账户，别忘了注册，我们在那里见。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Bye, guys.
segments.cn: 再见，大家。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
